titleStmt.title: URFA-136
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: The mixing çiğ, let’s say, the bulgur, first we bring the bulgur
There are two types of bulgur, the çiğ bulgur, the fine one
and its molasses and its pepper. A home dried pepper can be used, a homemade molasses can be used on it, basically what has already been made at home can be used
then you start to mix them. You cut four heads of garlic on them, the garlic
and some onions, a head of onions, let’s say, an onion, you cut a yellow onion on it, and these get mixed
you keep pouring slowly slowly water on them, and you mix them, you mix them until they get blended and then you put hot oil on them, hot oil, eggs
you break two eggs on them, and oil them slowly, you cut parsley on them and some green onion
These are basically put on it before oiling it, they get mixed, this is the çiğ with eggs
and the meat actually, the çiğ with meat is the same, the çiğ with cut meat, it is the same, basically its same bulgur and its molasses
and its same onion, the same, the same, but when you mix it, this one you mix it with ice, you mix it with an ice block
if you do not mind, until the water is almost gone, it keeps melting, this gets mixed until it becomes a little, until it becomes warm
unlike the çiğ with eggs, it becomes a little bit spicy, it basically gets mixed, it gets put on it afterwards, it gets knocked on the cut meat
the cut meat, now people in former times used to hit it on stones, and you saw the small miǧann, in former times, it would become better
but nowadays, it has become easier thanks to the robots, using the robot, the meat gets dragged, it gets put on it, it gets mixed the same, its vegetables are
so like that, like it, like its sister, but this one is made with meat. All of them are the same
they are all the same. And the one with lentil is basically the same, actually all of it, its bulgur, its onion and its garlic, the yellow (onion) ha!
All of them, when they get mixed, a small spoon of lentil should be added, a hot lentil soup, until it gets ready
I keep putting the lentil soup, whenever it has less water until it comes down, gets ready, and becomes good like dough
then I put on it, I oil an onion, oiling an onion is neither an innovation nor a workmanship (It is easy)
then the oiled onion will be put on it, this is basically the çiğ with lentil, and the other one is actually similar, the one with potato
the potato is basically boiled, let’s say, it gets boiled, it gets boiled, when it is hot, it is actually the same, basically the bulgur, the molasses and everything is the same, the same thing
and a yellow onion and the garlic is the same, (but) when it get mixed, potato will be put instead of lentil
the potato gets basically mixed with potato, and its oiling is basically oil and a yellow onion
this is basically the thing with potato, these are çiğ dishes, four types
